tags: Custom Speech datasets for model adaptation:
post.summary: Uploads data and creates a new dataset.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of this data import (always add this string for any import).

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional description of this data import.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The locale of this data import (always add this string for any import).

parameters.name: dataImportKind
parameters.description: The kind of the data import (always add this string for any import). Possible values are "Language", "Acoustic", "Pronunciation".

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Optional properties of this data import (json serialized object with key/values, where all values must be strings)

parameters.name: audiodata
parameters.description: A zip file containing the audio data (this and the audio archive file for acoustic data imports).

parameters.name: transcriptions
parameters.description: A text file containing the transcriptions for the audio data (this and the transcriptions file for acoustic data imports).

parameters.name: languagedata
parameters.description: A text file containing the language or pronunciation data (only this file for language data imports).

202.description: The response contains the location of the entity as header.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait before accessing the resource created in this operation.

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The limit of requests for the resource.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The remaining number of requests until the rate limit is reached.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The timestamp when the rate limit will be reset formatted as ISO 8601 combined date and time in UTC.

Location.description: The location of the created resource.

Operation-Location.description: The location of the created resource.

400.description: In case the operation cannot be performed successfully with the specified values.

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The limit of requests for the resource.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The remaining number of requests until the rate limit is reached.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The timestamp when the rate limit will be reset formatted as ISO 8601 combined date and time in UTC.

401.description: In case the user isn't authorized.

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The limit of requests for the resource.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The remaining number of requests until the rate limit is reached.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The timestamp when the rate limit will be reset formatted as ISO 8601 combined date and time in UTC.

403.description: In case authorized user isn't known or doesn't have the required permissions.

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The limit of requests for the resource.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The remaining number of requests until the rate limit is reached.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The timestamp when the rate limit will be reset formatted as ISO 8601 combined date and time in UTC.

415.description: In case the media type of a file part is not supported.

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The limit of requests for the resource.

ErrorContent.title: ErrorContent
ErrorContent.description: The interface represents the content of an error response defined in the OneAPI v2.1 documentation.

details.description: An array of details representing distinct related errors that occurred during the request.

code.description:
A service-defined error code that should be human-readable.
This code serves as a more specific indicator of the error than
the HTTP error code specified in the response.

message.description:
A human-readable representation of the error. It is intended as
an aid to developers and is not suitable for exposure to end users.

target.description: The target of the particular error (e.g., the name of the property in error).

ErrorDetail.title: ErrorDetail
ErrorDetail.description: An array of implementations of this interface can be used as details for an error.

the HTTP error code specified in the response.

message.description:

target.description: The target of the particular error (e.g., the name of the property in error).

InnerErrorV2.title: InnerErrorV2
InnerErrorV2.description:
An implementation of this interface represents a stage in a stack trace.
If the error level is the root, the Microsoft.SpeechServices.Http.Dto.IInnerError.Code and the Microsoft.SpeechServices.Http.Dto.IInnerError.InnerError
property may be omitted.

code.description:

the HTTP error code specified in the response.

resultsUrl.description:
The URL that can be used to download the test results.
Each line in the file represents a tab separated list of filename, reference transcription and decoder output.
            
The URL will only be valid, if the test completed successfully.
